Do you know why riot designed it to only apply after 40%?

It's a kill pressure item, designed so that once you get someone low they stay low and you can finish them off.

 The <35% thing specializes its purpose and allows it to be balanced around a smaller window of power (meaning its stats would be worse if it always applied grievous wounds)

There was a similar post somewhere, from a Soraka perspective, when enemy Vayne rushed {{item:3123}} . The lane was pretty rough for Soraka as she was only healing for half the normal value. 
But at the same time Vayne simply didn't have enough damage to kill anything due to rushing {{item:3123}}  so they eventually lost despite having early pressure on Soraka's lane.
This just shows it can be difficult to balance healing.

That's kind of a bad example, because Vayne doesn't actually benefit from that item a lot early game. Vayne has no poke at all, meaning that the only time that she's going to be applying GW is when she is going all in, and while cutting healing will certainly help, more damage would probably help Vayne more.

A better example would be Caitlin taking executioners, because her constant poke also applying GW would make Soraka's sustain weaker instead of just reducing her burst heals. This is why I take executioners on Gnar when I go against Vlad/Mundo/Swain because with a champion that can actually harass you can keep GW permanently applied.
